website_summaries.verdict: The ergonomic benefits separate it from the rest of the pack. The best snow shovel for the money.
pros: Ergonomic shaft and big handle allow for easy use
Light and strong, and the wear strip does not wear out
cons: Metal wear strip tends to catch on pavement

customer_reviews.title: Handle too short.
customer_reviews.text: I agree with the comment that the handle is too short. I used the shovel today for the first time and I had to bend slightly at the waist to use it. I could feel the strain in my lower back. I can see that if you are 5'6" that this shovel would be more comfortable than a traditional shovel. I am over 6'. It's a pain in the back.
customer_reviews.author: PSebelist

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shovel
customer_reviews.text: I could not wait to get a decent shovel that would not break my back. The first time I used it, I knew I made a good purchase. It worked great and didn't give me back pains, I am just so happy to have a decent shovel that is not 40 plus years old and worn out. When I used it some of the snow had begun to melt but it required very little effort to utilize. The shovel is well made and should last me a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lavoie

customer_reviews.title: Best Snow Shovel I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I bought this snow shovel as my wife took my older Suncast SC3250 to her goat dairy. I like the fact that you can push it like a snow plow. I was breaking up ice with its steel edge. It is very high quality. The bent handle makes all the difference. I am glad I did not read the negative reviews as it may have stop me from buying this shovel. This is my 3rd snow season and the older shovel looks brand new. I will always replace this shovel with the same model. My height is 5" 10 inches.
customer_reviews.author: DavidTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Best ergonomic shovel available for those with bad backs!
customer_reviews.text: Product is as described: light weight, sturdy, and the metal strip at the base of the shovel allows for easy scooping. I am 5'11" with a bad lower back. I've tested many of the shovels on the market today. This one is by far the best for me. The shape of the handle is what allows me to shovel without much bending and it's easy to lift and toss the snow to the side. I don't understand why this design is not being carried by retail companies any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Music lover

customer_reviews.title: Good quality at a good price point.
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated, well-built and sturdy as these shovels go. Better than a yellow True Temper and blue Avalanche brand that I have. I also like the sharper bends in this handle versus the more curved handles of the aforementioned alternatives. I've had a bad back all my life and shovels like this make a huge difference for me in the winter. Came in a huge cardboard box from Amazon, it was kind of comical.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: My favorite shovel since my back surgery
customer_reviews.text: I have titanium in my spine and I bought two of these shovels because I like them so much. I’m 5’11” and this shovel is perfect
customer_reviews.author: Wagger

customer_reviews.title: Snow is everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: We live in South Carolina and had a big snowstorm last Jan. that no one was prepared for. I tried to buy a snow shovel for this winter in a store here in Charleston and was laughed at by the store employees. I ordered this for my husband, as it was similar to the one he used to use in NY. I hope we never need it, but it is comforting to have. The handle is good for his bad back.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara L

customer_reviews.title: Best snow shovel! Just got my second. Be prepared!
customer_reviews.text: Had one for 15 yrs in MN and wore it out. Just got another after a 100 yr snow event in Sequim WA. It's so strong, ergonomic, love the steel strip on the blade, great at both pushing and lifting, even with my dodgy lower back. You may not be able to find such a quality shovel in big box stores, so get one in advance, rather than wasting money on flimsy tinny or all plastic junk. With this one work is fast, so you can have energy to help your neighbors, especially widows of single moms or others in distress. :-)
customer_reviews.author: A. Fane

customer_reviews.title: Regret this purchase and bit the bullet to pay to ...
customer_reviews.text: Regret this purchase and bit the bullet to pay to ship back for refund. Heavy, clunky and awkward to lift snow up and out of the way. Would be okay I guess if you just plowed snow.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: shovel review
customer_reviews.text: It is a great quality item and I would recommend it to tall, strong men and women. It's made more for a taller person. I'm 4'10" and find it too clumsy and too heavy to use comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie

customer_reviews.title: A design improvement on US-made aluminum-bladed snow shovels
customer_reviews.text: Apparently they no longer make steel-bladed snow shovels. Previously I purchased a US-made aluminum-bladed snow shovel with a riveted steel edge strip. Over one Saint Louis winter the rivets eroded sufficiently so that the riveted steel edge strip came loose, and the aluminum blade was too flimsy to shovel snow. This affordable snow shovel has a plastic blade with a riveted steel edge strip, but the rivets are inset in depressions: the rivets are not eroded during shoveling. And the shovel's plastic blade appears stiffer than my previous shovel's aluminum blade. I am confident that this affordable shovel will last longer than my former US-made aluminum-bladed snow shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Ballard

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I'm probably the only one in Southern California that has purchased one since we never get snow. I bought one for the recent mud flows caused by fire and then flood. It picked up the mud well and was strong enough to pick up a shovel full of the heavy stuff for dumping into the wheelbarrow. However, some laborers I hired to help me, didn't like it and went back to the traditional metal ones.
customer_reviews.author: W. N. Thiel

customer_reviews.title: Sticky Sticker on Blade
customer_reviews.text: Good news, quality snow shovel with sturdy D-handle, good length, and jag in the shaft provides good angle of attack. Durable. Steel leading edge. Bad news, sticker on the blade is a time-consuming pain to remove, even with Goo Gone. Shovel recommended. Sticker not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Hate it
customer_reviews.text: It seems study and is light weight, but that does not compensate for the huge flaw in the design and materials that makes it useless to me. With the built up sides and the material this is built of it this makes knocking the snow off almost impossible. I find the ergonomic shape aggravates that same problem. I can't get snow off of this shovel. Not only would I not recommend to others I'm looking for a new shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Ritch

customer_reviews.title: Great but Pricey
customer_reviews.text: 1 Year Update: Still great. The metal edge slowly starts to curl/bend sometimes mid-shovel, but it's easy to bend it back. Slight con, but I'm still a fan. No other issues. So far so good, but have only used it once. It came in good condition, with the blade straight. The only con at the moment is the price. I expect to update in the future with how it holds up
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I've never used a shovel with a curved handle before, but it really makes a difference. The blade does a good job of getting very close to the pavement. It feels well constructed, and pushing the snow is quite effective. Not bad for the price either. I was a bit confused by the huge box, but I guess until we find a better way eh?
customer_reviews.author: Scotty Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Not ergonomic for Big & Tall
customer_reviews.text: Yeah it's a decent shovel, slightly ergonomic only if you're under 6ft tall. If like me you're over 6ft, you still have to bend down to grab the handle, even at the big bend it has. My lower back is reminding me of this now. Maybe there's a Big & Tall version...
customer_reviews.author: Big B

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Finally used this winter. Worked well, was sturdy, easy to push snow and scoop. Obviously it works better on loose snow then ice, so key is getting out thier and shoveling right away! Lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: No Better Design
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these for years and now needed a second one. This design really does make a huge difference in the wear and tear on your back versus a conventional shovel. Also, this is the best price I've found anywhere. It's a win-win situation.
customer_reviews.author: P Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Turns 10lbs into 2lbs
customer_reviews.text: The curvature and firmness of the blade make lifting otherwise intolerably heavy shovel-loads of snow into truly a fraction of the pain and effort needed. The handle is very thick and firm steel with no signs of any bending. The shovel itself is a hard plastic whose ridges give it honey-comb like strength. The steel edge on the shovel is extremely wise given realities of driveways. Combined, this thing will last many many years. Its shape is ergonomic which doesn't mean some princess-like idea but the reality that you more comfortably lift more snow and get more done. You'll also be very satisfied with this shovel's construction as well as ergonomic design.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Chen

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great
customer_reviews.text: Looks and feels well made. I simulated shoveling snow and it feels like it will be comfortable to use. Since it's been in the low to mid 60's here in OH, I don't know if I'll have to use it this year. Damn you El Nino!, I want some cold air to kill of the bugs!!! Update: 6//10/2016...I would change my rating to 3.5 now. The edge of the shovel catches on the small imperfection on my driveway and causes you to stop suddenly. It gets annoying real fast. I stopped using this shovel and bought another that I love.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Salt

customer_reviews.title: Best snow shovel
customer_reviews.text: So far this is the best snow shovel that l ever used. This is the second one that I bought when times when you need two. The first one is still going strong after six years.
customer_reviews.author: E. Caranto

customer_reviews.title: Good but too long for me
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, useful shovel. However, it is too long for me. I’m a 5’2” woman and the center of balance is off. I can’t lift the shovel with one hand on the handle at the end and the other down far enough towards the shovel end. I didn’t realize that it was possible for a shovel it be too big until I used it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy F

customer_reviews.title: Great Music that doesn't bore you
customer_reviews.text: I am easily bored by repetitive and/or pop music, which can be great the first 1000 times you hear a song, but then get old. This music is timeless. You will not get bored. You will find it hard not to dance around the room.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Winter was coming John Snow
customer_reviews.text: I was in such a panic to get a new snow shovel, I ordered this prior to a storm last fall. That storm was a bust, and I think I spent more time unwrapping the packaging and piling it together for the recycling than I would have if I'd stopped at a hardware store. Then came the famous Massachusetts winter of 2015. Through storm after storm, this shovel got me through without serious back problems. Very happy with this purchase, as well as my prescience in getting ready for the long winter that wouldn't end.
customer_reviews.author: Giuditta

customer_reviews.title: Easy on the back!
customer_reviews.text: Glad I had this during our Winter snowfalls! As a senior citizen, I found it much easier on the back lifting, or simply pushing away heavy wet snow.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Lover

customer_reviews.title: I like how it saves my back and it's light
customer_reviews.text: I spent way too much time reading and reviewing too many shovel reviews. I got the big Ames one too with the wide yellow scoop. And I have traditional shovels also. This one, however, is my go-to shovel for quick work of all kinds of snow. I like how it saves my back and it's light. I wouldn't hesitate to get this shovel. With any lightweight shovel, I don't pound it down against gravel or concrete. Use it to scoop snow and you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: TSH71

customer_reviews.title: Excellent snow shovel
customer_reviews.text: Bought this snow shovel, my first snow shovel, and loved it. Easy to carry and store. Works great. 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Ivan A Cruz

customer_reviews.title: excellent shovel that is getting lots of use this year
customer_reviews.text: We moved last year and left all our old bent snow shovels in the trash rather than pay to store and then move them. This one has a great edge and is easy on the back - 2 requirements we had. Plus, it fits nicely in the trunk of our SUV when we want to take it along to help shovel out grand-dad. We have had lots of opportunity to use this wonderful shovel this year with all the snow we have been getting, and getting, and getting....so we highly recommend this shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle in Philadelphia suburbs

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it without attachment
customer_reviews.text: Look for the Stout Backsaver Grip Attachment for Garden Tools and use it with this shovel and you'll be VERY happy. Without it the bend on the shaft is so extreme that you don't get good leverage and you hurt your back bending over all the time. Ironic, eh?
customer_reviews.author: J. F. Beck

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Worth the price. The shovel has not cracked or chipped so far. Indeed made from quality material. Looking forward to use this shovel in many more winter seasons. The curved handle makes it easy on your back when you have a heavy load to throw. The grip is nice too.
customer_reviews.author: GGSM Mobile

customer_reviews.title: Don't Try Shoveling Without This Wonder
customer_reviews.text: I live in the Blue Ridge Mountains of Virginia, just above the snow line so we get our fair share every year. This year I treated myself to this shovel hoping it would work as advertised. What a difference it makes! The first snow of 4 inches arrived a few days after I received this shovel and clearing the decks was a breeze! I am in my 70's and have lived here for 20 years, so am very familiar with shovels and heavy snows. This stands to get my vote for best tool of the year!
customer_reviews.author: Jean H Hart

customer_reviews.title: Shovel effective
customer_reviews.text: One snow day of six inches, shoveled a large cement drive clean. Worked well as both a push shovel and a scoop shovel. Felt awkward but seemed like it was easier on the back when scooping heavy mounds.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Silverstein

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Tool.  It shovels snow.  If you have snow on your driveway or sidewalk, you need this tool, or one like it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this from Amazon because my previous snow shovel literally wore out from all the snow and ice we got this winter (2013-2014). I was unable to find any store locally that still had snow shovels in stock. I found this online and I was very pleased with the price and the quick delivery. I should add it's lightweight, which I like. Does the ergonomic design help???? I'm not sure but i have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Lakeside Denny

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, feels comfortably light to hold. appears to be a keeper..also well protected in shipping packaging
customer_reviews.text: So Glad I haven't had the opportunity to use it yet!!!; however, compared to the ergonomic shovel I replaced with this one..IT IS DEFINITELY A BETTER QUALITY PRODUCT!!! It is lighter and the bottom edge of the shovel looks like it will tolerate ice breaking and shoveling against frozen snow without the wear I experienced ion my former shovel. I can't give it an experiential rating until I actually use it.
customer_reviews.author: Yogababebk

customer_reviews.title: I bought this not for snow but for scooping up ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this not for snow but for scooping up leaves without having to bend my 82 year old back too much. Haven't tried it on dry leaves yet since the rains refuse to stop falling in Oregon, but I found it is very efficient in scraping up wet leaves from cement and wood decking, much faster and easier than a patio broom.
customer_reviews.author: Jim D.

customer_reviews.title: Easy lifting, strong construction
customer_reviews.text: I love this type of shovel with the angled handle. Makes lifting the snow a whole lot easier. I'm older (70) but not dead... I still shovel my own driveway. I really appreciate the design on this shovel. I'll be buying another one before next winter.
customer_reviews.author: DooWopFan

customer_reviews.title: What a nice packaging (or not!)
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried it yet, but I am sure will be a comfortable and effective shovel since I have had one of these for a few years which (although has crack at edge of shovel) it is still useable. Anyway, the main reason I am writing this review is for the way it was sent by the seller (other than Amazon). It was shipped as is without any bulky and useless package, it was delivered to my door w/o any issue, and I did appreciate not to mess with a large box!
customer_reviews.author: SZ-Frm Hls

customer_reviews.title: Hated it at First - Love it Now!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly didn't like it at first, but once I got the hang of using it, I really like it - and so does my back. Part of the area I have to shovel has a fence that I have to toss the snow over. This design allows me to pull up with my left, while pushing down with my right, flinging the snow over the fence much more easily than with a standard snow shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Kylie

customer_reviews.title: Good multi-tasker shovel and easy on the back
customer_reviews.text: Got it just in time to dig out 5" of wet snow. It did great at scooping slush and snow. It fits so much in a single scoop that it can get quite heavy. I used the metal edge to break up the ice cover and scoop it up like a spatula. The next day I had sore muscles but only in the arms and shoulders, not lower or mid back. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jill E. E.

customer_reviews.title: ... have a shovel similar to this one that I loved, so I was hopeful buying this one
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a shovel similar to this one that I loved, so I was hopeful buying this one. But it is a terrible design that places your hands so close together so if you have to throw the snow on, say a 7' snow bank like we have to here in Boston, it's nearly impossible. Next shovel purchased will not have a curve in the handle
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: The angled handle does really help your back. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Fausto

customer_reviews.title: Back Saver!
customer_reviews.text: Just used this snow shovel for the first two snowfalls of 2015 in Pittsburgh, and was very happy with it. No lower-back stress because I didn't have to bend down as much to grab and lift the shovel as with my straight-handled snow shovel. Also pushed 2 inches of snow very easily. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle R Bahr

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic cool shovel
customer_reviews.text: Works well but hard to lift snow up and over. Perfect for just pushing
customer_reviews.author: Sue Fegan

customer_reviews.title: good shovel, better on your back
customer_reviews.text: only used once since my other shovel broke after 30 inch snowstorm we had in the mid-atlantic this past winter. Much better on my bad back
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: shovel worked as it should
customer_reviews.text: Great investment, not too soon after I got it, it snowed. I love the metal edge got right under the snow. This shovel replaces a cheaper one I got from Home Depot that lasted since 2010. From the build of this one, its pretty sturdy, definitely heavier then my previous home depot shovel, but my home depot shovel didn't have the metal edge. The price is also just right.... can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Wyl Apache

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Lightweigth but needs a bigger metal strip. Ergonomic deisgn is over-rated and hard to throw heavy snow
customer_reviews.author: Karen Stein

customer_reviews.title: liked it well enough to order the same again
customer_reviews.text: It is as advertised. Had a previous one. After years of use finally broke it prying upward under icy snow. However, liked it well enough to order the same again. Sometimes you just have to use a rigid metal shovel when it comes to ice.
customer_reviews.author: JN

customer_reviews.title: it's OK for me, but GOOD for my back
customer_reviews.text: Personally, I like this style except that I don't like the metal edge. My last one like this has a plastic edge, and altho it wore down over about 4 years, I liked they was it glided along the sidewalk / driveway better. For folks with lower back issues, this handle shape helps to keep you from bending over too mush. The lifting is all done with the arms instead.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Eckert

customer_reviews.title: Great if you have a bad back
customer_reviews.text: Great if you have a bad back. I shoveled the porch's, walk and driveway and didn't tired once nor did I get a backache. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Smith

customer_reviews.title: The steel blade has made it harder for me to ...
customer_reviews.text: The steel blade has made it harder for me to shovel because it keeps getting stuck in little bits of ice. Too heavy for me to make it easier when adding to piles of snow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoveling
customer_reviews.text: I was grateful for the ergonomic handle - less stooping, much easier to use legs to lift and move snow. Found it best to alternate sides too which was easy to do. Did not feel awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Sunflower Mom

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these. I bought this one and had it shipped to my daughter in Washington state.
customer_reviews.author: Loganator

customer_reviews.title: Easier on the Back
customer_reviews.text: Shoveling heavy snow is significantly easier with this shovel than with my previous straight-handled one. It's a lot easier on my back. It's not the widest, but for the price this is a great shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Helius

customer_reviews.title: Suncast SC 3250 for Mayor
customer_reviews.text: New England needs good shovels and this is one. It lifts the snow and the base layer of shlush with ease. I would vote this shovel for Mayor. It would clean up all that stuff! And my back does not hurt after shoveling.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Adler  Esq.

customer_reviews.title: Snow-gone!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have product for all New Englanders. It utilizes your muscles to move the snow from a place you don't want it, to a place you do want it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I really like the way the Suncast handle is bent. Maybe its just me, but it fits my 5' 11" size well. shovel is the right size. I use this as much for moving wood chips as for snow. better than a pitch fork.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If U a Snow Shovel then get a Suncast I recommend it, it works 4 me
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, and saves the back pain, just don't overload the scoop on the shovel, after all U want to live to shovel another day. If U a Snow Shovel then get a Suncast I recommend it, it works 4 me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A real back saver!
customer_reviews.text: Great ergonomic design, easy on back and works well for either throwing the snow or pushing it - wish I had bought it earlier. If you spray either silicone spray or PAM on the blade before using even the wettest snow does not stick on the blade
customer_reviews.author: Maturity

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective on other than fluffy snow
customer_reviews.text: It's okay for fluffy snow, I guess. But I live in the city. As soon as foot traffic compounds the snow, the shovel is entirely ineffective.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Kosciusko

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is heavier than I expected, but well-built and does the job well..
customer_reviews.author: happy in Iowa

customer_reviews.title: The shovel is very light and sturdy and is much easier on the back as i'd ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this shovel as i now own a home when i previously owned a condo. I didn't have the $ for a snow blower so i decided to go with this shovel for the time being. The shovel is very light and sturdy and is much easier on the back as i'd hoped. It arrived on time and was packed well.
customer_reviews.author: vhrules

customer_reviews.title: It shovels the snow!!!!
customer_reviews.text: So I was deployed and my wife decided to use a rake to shovel our driveway, she broke the rake. She didnt see the need for a snow shovel (eventhough she had just broke my rake) so I bought her this one. It got there in 2 days and eventhough it hasnt snowed since I bought it for her, I know that she will not need to break my rake ever again. thank you
customer_reviews.author: Joey Mac Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Good Item!
customer_reviews.text: Too early to use this just yet. The quality is excellent. It is fairly light weight, but not flimsy. Great size to prevent over exertion. Also, the ergonomic handle and scraper edge.will make shoveling snow and ice removal much easier. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta Nickerson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Shovel was so heavy. It pushed the snow but now you're battling the weight of the shovel and the snow you're pushing. Wouldn't advise using this shovel to lift and throw snow. Just for pushing show and make sure you wear boots with traction to help accomplish the task
customer_reviews.author: Crystyl Clear

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable especially in the handle. Edge of shovel is nicely tipped.
customer_reviews.author: Melba

customer_reviews.title: Works good on my driveway.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this shovel. Easy to use and seems to be made to last. My old ergo shovel did not have a metal edge and was shallow in capacity which made it lighter in weight. This Suncast is slighty heavier but for good reson. Overall it gets the job done well with minimal effort.
customer_reviews.author: bethee

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: bought as a gift for my son-in-law. He is very hard on shovels and we are in Michigan so they get a work out. He likes the ergonomic handle. Good quality product
customer_reviews.author: Niles, MI

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: The shovel is to narrow and shallow. Angle on handle is not as comfortable when lifting.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Knowall

customer_reviews.title: still wrapped in the mud room ... and that's OK by me
customer_reviews.text: since purchasing this we haven't had measurable or shovel-able snow so it's working well for me ;-) ... if I never take off the plastic wrap, that'll be just fine
customer_reviews.author: C. Winkler

customer_reviews.title: Save your back!
customer_reviews.text: This is made at the perfect angle. I've had to shovel a lot this year and I'm so happy with this shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SHOVEL!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a friend of mine who had just moved to Reno from California and had never shoveled snow before. He has now had lots of snow to practice on and said he loves this shovel. He has his daughter using it also.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen D.

customer_reviews.title: Shovel
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction, the curved handle helps with your back but it also makes it hard to break up ice. Buy in the summer to avoid crazy winter price hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan G

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Feels sturdy, but haven't gotten enough snow since receiving it to judge its performance
customer_reviews.author: DRS

customer_reviews.title: Good Snow shovel
customer_reviews.text: using it for when we have snow in NYC works well
customer_reviews.author: red011565

customer_reviews.title: WE NEEDED A BACK SAVER.
customer_reviews.text: OLDEST SON NEEDED A SHOVEL FOR HEAVY SNOW REMOVAL. HE HAD JUST BROKEN HIS WHEN WE SEEN THIS ONE OFFERED. WE ORDERED IT RIGHT AWAY. WE ARE GLAD WE DID. WE HAD A LOT OF SNOW THIS WINTER. HE REALLY APPRECIATED THIS LITTLE GIFT. THANKS
customer_reviews.author: RCD SJD

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic Desigh
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this when the snow was coming down like crazy and the snow shovel we'd recently purchased was falling apart. This one has made it through several feet of new snow and is still going strong. So glad I ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: M&MTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Back friendly.
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well. It's lightweight ( without snow ). I wiped it down with silicon oil to keep the snow from sticking. WD-40 works also. This is not a problem with the shovel it's what snow does. I'm very happy with it and plan on using it to spread mulch in the Spring.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C

customer_reviews.title: Neighbor that received this says "AWESOME AND LOVE THE METAL STRIP ON THE EDGE.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as thank you gift for wonderful neighbor doing fantastic job clearing my snow each winter. HE loves it and especially the metal strip on the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Clara LaMarr

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and gets rid of the ice
customer_reviews.text: The thing I like about this shovel, is that it has the metal strip to get to the blacktop, but is not real heavy like my other one. Nice purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Roman Urbanski

customer_reviews.title: well built and designed product
customer_reviews.text: haven't really had a chance to use this yet but it feels great...like it will take a lot of the stress out of the job on your back....
customer_reviews.author: CyberHillbilly

customer_reviews.title: No more backaches, yeah!
customer_reviews.text: Better than the grain shovel I have used for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta

customer_reviews.title: Husband Likes it
customer_reviews.text: Okay, shoveling snow isn't anyone's idea of a good time. But having this shovel is a good start. It's easy on the back and the sharp edge helps cut through the ice. The husband is happy with it which makes me a happy wife with snow-free steps. :)
customer_reviews.author: E. K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Light and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Californian in Iowa. I barely know how to shovel snow, but this thing got me through the first snowstorm of the year, the bent arm made it easier to shovel snow without hunching over, and it's sturdy enough that I used it to bang hard on some ice with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gowder

customer_reviews.title: Shoveling sniw
customer_reviews.text: Good general snow shovel. Ergonomic handle makes it easier to lift and toss the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Wright

customer_reviews.title: Well made shovel with a metal edge to it. ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made shovel with a metal edge to it. Not sure about the ergonomics of having the angled handle, I wish I would have gotten a standard straight handle. I think that may just be personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: Matt E

customer_reviews.title: Great product and so much better on the back
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'2" and always seem to have issues with shovels, rakes, etc. Though this is a full size snow shovel, it was PERFECT for my size, so easy to use, and a lot less strain on my back (which is what I needed since I already have a bad back). I even had my 10 yr old twins helping and they used the shovel with ease. I was able to scoop all the snow from my driveway and deck in about 30min which was way less time than I had expected that it would take. Great shovel. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MS. MO to VA

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Hardworking Snow Shovel
customer_reviews.text: This ergonomically designed snow shovel is fantastic. It is light and easy to use, yet is durable enough for even the tough stuff. It is good for getting into tighter spaces. It got its first true use, this morning. I used it on mine and four of my neighbors' driveways. It proved well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: William Maxheimer

customer_reviews.title: Used it today (boo hoo) but it did a great job and didn't scratch because the blade is good ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it today (boo hoo) but it did a great job and didn't scratch because the blade is good quality so far...
customer_reviews.author: Natick Franks

customer_reviews.title: It's a keeper
customer_reviews.text: Works great, light weight, and holds up even for ice.
customer_reviews.author: NSeattle

customer_reviews.title: And since this one is metal I don't think my husband will break this one so easily.
customer_reviews.text: More ergonomically correct than my last shovel. And since this one is metal I don't think my husband will break this one so easily.
customer_reviews.author: ynona74

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works fine but the handle could be a bit longer.

customer_reviews.title: Ready for Winter
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly arrived fully assembled, Looks well made, but won't be able to evaluate it's quality until it snows — which​ could be any second now!

customer_reviews.title: Entry holes did not line-up great.
customer_reviews.text: Screws a bit hard to get in. Entry holes did not line-up great.
customer_reviews.author: michelle k

customer_reviews.title: good shovel
customer_reviews.text: good shovel and certainly much easier on the back than a regular snow shovel. The way the shovel is attached to the handle is a bit weak and not certain how long it will last, probably would be better of there were better fasteners used,
customer_reviews.author: BillVa

customer_reviews.title: Hand snow plow. No lifting required. Great for reducing back injury
customer_reviews.text: Works like a snow plow. Just push. No lifting required
customer_reviews.author: william schoepp

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic design makes it easy to
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous back saver. Ergonomic design makes it easy to push

customer_reviews.title: They love the style and pretty easy to use because of ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter and her husband. They love the style and pretty easy to use because of the design. It was a good choice!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Thiery

customer_reviews.title: very good product, have one just like it
customer_reviews.text: very good product,have one just like it ,and it has lasted 10 years!! great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: billium

customer_reviews.title: Best snow shovel I've ever used!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for this exact model snow shovel to replace one used since 1999 in Colorado and finally found it here on Amazon. It is good quality, easy to use and does the job. Hopefully, it will last 16 years like the last one!
customer_reviews.author: DL

product_meta.title: Suncast SC3250 18-Inch Snow Shovel/Pusher Combo with Ergonomic Shaped Handle and Wear Strip, Green
product_meta.description:
Remove snow more easily with the versatile Suncast 18 in. (width of blade) Bent Handle Snow Shovel. The deep blade and angled rib pattern allow you to both shovel and push snow with just one tool. The ergonomic bent handle design helps give less strain on your back when shoveling. This allows more for efficient shoveling saving you time. It includes a galvanized steel wear strip. Use this shovel all around whether its on a sidewalk or in your driveway. The winter season can bring a ton of snow with it; show you are ready with the Suncast Bent Handle Snow Shovel.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Snow shovel/pusher ergonomic combination with S handle to reduce stress. Galvanized steel wear strip.
feature_bullets: DURABLE: 40 in. steel handle with galvanized steel wear strip
ERGONOMIC: Bent handle for comfort and repeated use
LONG-LASTING: Coated platic 18 in. blade width
EASY TO USE: Angled rib pattern makes the job go quickly. Perfect for shoveling your driveway, walkways, and sidewalks

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars536 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
